meanings.definition: To transfer or bequeath property by will or lease.
meanings.sent1: She demised her family heirlooms to her grandchildren in her will.
meanings.sent2: The landlord demised the apartment to the new tenants through a lease agreement.
meanings.sent3: The old man jokingly demised his collection of hats to the local museum.
meanings.sent4: The artist demised his masterpiece to the art gallery, ensuring its legacy.
meanings.sent5: The queen demised her crown to the next in line to the throne, marking a new era.

meanings.sent1: After a long illness, the elderly cat demised peacefully in its sleep.
meanings.sent2: The old tree demised in the storm, falling to the ground with a loud crash.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that his career would demised if he couldn't make people laugh.
meanings.sent4: The candle slowly demised, flickering out as the wax melted away.
meanings.sent5: The ancient civilization demised, leaving behind only ruins and legends.

meanings.definition: To convey or transfer (an estate) by will or lease.
meanings.sent1: The wealthy businessman demised his entire estate to his only son.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer demised the property to the rightful heirs according to the will.
meanings.sent3: The ghost in the story demised its haunted mansion to the unsuspecting family.
meanings.sent4: The author demised the fictional kingdom to the protagonist, setting up the next adventure.
meanings.sent5: The wizard demised his magical powers to the chosen apprentice, passing on his legacy.
